analysis:
Entries in art and design subjects have decreased across the UK over the last four years. The -8.1% change compared to a change of +3.6% in all GCSE entries over the last four years. Over the same period, the 16-year-old population has changed by approximately -6.2%.

Across the UK, a greater proportion of students achieved good passes in art and design subjects in 2018 compared to all GCSE subjects. A total of 75.1% of pupils achieved grade C/4 or higher in art and design subjects compared to 66.9% for all subjects.
